pr_title: Add a new command to get all Java projects

timeline.message:
Add a new command to get all Java projects

Signed-off-by: Sheng Chen <sheche@microsoft.com>

timeline.author: fbricon

timeline.bodyText: Why don't you return the default project? Might be valuable information to get for standalone Java files
timeline.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText: Because I'm thinking that the project path of the default project is totally different from that of the standalone Java files. The client side needs to have a way to resolve such mapping...
replies.author: jdneo

replies.bodyText: well, no mapping = default project, no?
replies.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText:
Yes, I also thinks of that actually. What I'm afraid is, it might be in some situation that the client side cache is out of sync?
Hmm, Can I say that, if a java file does not belongs to any workspace folder, then it belongs to the default project?
replies.author: jdneo

replies.bodyText: I think that's probably an accurate assumption.
replies.author: fbricon

timeline.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText: Hmm, I think I need to install a spelling checking extension. 😄
replies.author: jdneo

timeline.message:
Return default project as well

Signed-off-by: Sheng Chen <sheche@microsoft.com>
